The chicken and rich along with the naan were more than filling on their own - I'm looking forward to eating my left overs for lunch tomorrow.The only complaint I have is that the deliver did take a while. I ordered on Seamless Web and it did say it would take 60-75 minutes, which was pretty accurate, I guess it was just wishful thinking on my part ... or I was very hungry :) I think I found a new go to spot for take out.
The best Indian food I've ever had. Great service as well. Must try any of the puffed fresh baked bread and chicken tikka masala!!!
Great lunch buffet. Excellent Indian food. Have dined in and had delivery. Yummy each time. Best Indian food in Hoboken.
Delicious and very good variety at lunch buffet.$10 is an amazing price!!!
Exceptional food. The buffet always has something new and different. The Lamb biryani is to die for also...i've been eating it for years now.

Karma Kafe serves superior quality Indian food, (... and probably the best in Hoboken). In addition, their staff are extremely professional and hospitable. If you stop in to order take out on your way home as I do on occasion, they will pour you a glass of water and treat you as though you're dining in while you place your order at your leisure and wait on your food to be prepared (which doesn't take long). If you live  in Hoboken and enjoy Indian food but haven't yet tried Karma Kafe, it's worth trying this restaurant.

If you know what REAL Indian food tastes like you wouldnt go there. Absolutely mediocre! I can't seem to understand how you can sell that food to people. I believe a humble home-cooked Indian meal is wayyy better than what Karma Kafe has to offer!!!

Best Indian food I have ever had. This place can be pricey unless you go to the lunch buffet. I have gone to the buffet on the weekends and it is always fresh and there are a ton of vegetarian options.

First off, I found this place on Yelp, on a review for a different restaurant! An acquaintance was working for a time for an Indian Place in Hoboken called Bombay West; he encouraged me to try it, so naturally i went to Yelp to check on its reviews. It had a lackluster 3 stars and relatively few reviews, and a lot of the reviewers seemed to use Karma Kafe at a base for Comparison. After Perusing their attractive internet menu, I ordered a couple of the Lunch Box Combos from Karma Kafe. It was terrific! I haven't had Indian food in months and it really satisfied me, the price was affordable and the food quality excellent. The Staff was professional and the Naan delicious! I will certainly order from here again!
Awesome food, great price, excellent variety.  I highly recommend the rice cassaorles.  You cannot go wrong!

I am not usually a fan of Indian food, but Karma Kafe may just have changed my mind.  I stopped in for their $9.95 lunch buffet and fell in love with the aromatic delights.  The restaurant offers relaxing seating in a traditionally decorated dining room or at a relaxing table out on the sidewalk.  The service was the one downfall.  Our waiter was pretty rude and extremely unfriendly.  I apologize for not knowing the names of anything that I sampled from the buffet, but I will do my best to describe the yumminess.  A dish of creamy spinach with cheese chunks was an interesting combination that I thoroughly enjoyed.  A stew of carrots, peas, and other vegetables was actually sweet and one of my favorite dishes on the buffet.  The curry chicken was also tasty and perfect for me, though many would probably prefer to have it spicier.  The Tandoori Chicken was perfectly cooked and savory.  The naan had a slight spiciness to it and was served with a creamy lentil sauce that I loved.  They also offered a sad looking caesar salad, which I avoided, and some spicy cole slawish-salad that was very refreshing.While I am not an expert on Indian food, I did enjoy Karma Kafe.

Usefully, they validate parking at the 2nd and River location. Didn't know that until a friend visited and they pulled out their parking ticket with their credit card.The servings here of most dishes come with a cool lentil soup, a bed of basmati rice, and a little bit of salad. I rarely eat the salad, though.Naan here comes literally one piece (cut into two) per order. Sometimes overcooked and crisp, slightly disappointing. The garlic naan here wasn't nearly as buttery and garlicky as I would've liked.On the other hand, the vindaloo curry is super-spicy, even for the Indian friends I brought along that claimed to be able to eat anything..! There's more than enough sauce on most dishes to dip your naan of choice into it, though. The chicken tikka masala is delicious, spicy or not (although if you get a spicy dish after ordering non-spicy, they just dilute it with some cream to remove the spiciness). A bit of hard bread at the beginning to snack on while you wait for your order, too, along with some spicy sauces (3) for tasting.Decently packed, and some "traditional" seating near the windows, but for the most part, filled with space for people to relax in.

Best Indian food in Hoboken. Very nice variety of naan and vegetarian options. I recommend the Paneer Palak or Paneer Kashmiri and garlic naan - has never dissapointed. Have only used Karma Kafe for delivery, and the order has always been correct and hot when it arrived. A staple in my delivery rolodex for Hoboken.
Outstanding!  The only thing I could ask for was more room at and around the table, because it was such a cozy place.  Can't wait to go back this weekend!
I go for the lunch buffet at least once a week.  Love the dishes they have.  They don't offer a bunch, but what they do offer, I like.  Try the spinache, soo good.

I ordered from Karma Kafe yesterday. Their food has always been consistently good, I admit. The reason I am giving them a 2 star review is because of poor customer service. I made an order through Delivery.com at 6:04pm and didn't receive the delivery until 2 hours later. When I called the restaurant, they didn't apologize, simply stating that the delivery was sent out. When the delivery person came, she also reiterated the same statements. I didn't tip her, given her lack of customer service (and I am a good tipper). Of interest, Karma Kafe also charges a $2 delivery fee, which does not include the tip. For what?!If they simply apologized, that would have sufficed as I understand that these things can happen from time to time. But the lack of good customer service will cause me to avoid an otherwise decent restaurant.05/13/2010: Received an apology from the restaurant with a 50% discount off the next order. I appreciated the apology and have updated my review to reflect.

Let me start my review by saying that I have only had food delivered from Karma, I have never dined in. My roommate introduced me to indian food, and Karma has been my go-to spot whenever I get a craving for it. I have had a few things on the menu and the food is usually delicious. I was surprised, however, that no other reviewers have encountered the same issue as me- I have found that the food is often inconsistent. Like I said, Karma is my first experience with indian food so I am not sure how things are supposed to taste, I just know what I like. And I have noticed when ordering the same thing repeatedly, it has been somewhat different every time. Examples-Onion kulcha- usually delicious, sometimes underdone (I don't like mine crispy so I don't mind this very much), often not enough onion at all.Raita- one of my favorite dipping sauces ever, but the consistency and taste has been different lately. I have had it the consistency of yogurt, and also the consistency of milk, and everything in between. Several times it has also had a noticeable sweet flavor that isn't usually there.Pakora- sometimes they are very good, but sometimes they are very very oily and over-fried. The seasoning is usually spot-on though.These three are items I order regularly. The gingery coconut chicken soup is delicious (somewhat salty, but still delicious).As other reviewers have noted, the delivery is not speedy whatsoever. It has taken up to two hours for me to receive a dinner order on a random week night. One time, I was told the delivery person was a block away from my apartment after waiting over an hour for my food to arrive. 30 minutes later, I called again and was put on "hold" (I could hear everything going on), the gentleman who answered the phone scolded the delivery person and asked him why my order had been sitting there for an hour. He then returned to the phone and apologized and said that the delivery person was a block away (again) and would be there shortly. It was clearly a lie, but my food did arrive after that, albeit very late, and also cold (I had ordered soup).I have become frustrated with the service lately and am ordering much less often, but some days the food is worth the wait.

I may not know whether that sauce is salad dressing or dessert, but it is damn delicious.The $10 lunch buffet with a sweet spread tastes great if you're not too picky about your Indian food. I was told by an Indian friend that this place is not the best for Indian, but it does the trick for me.Good place to introduce someone to Indian food.

We ordered via seamless from Karma and I felt like I had to write this bad review. We had tried Karma Kafe food many times since moving to Jersey City. The lamb was overcooked, under marinated and almost too chewy and the chicken was meh ok. Not sure if the chef changed/ quality dipped/ they had a bad day, but I was dissapointed with not so authentic and sub standard indian food.

First of all, you can't expect easy parking and congestion in that glamorous part of Hoboken. So be ready! For us, it wasn't pleasant experience as long as seating and ambience is concerned. Food was decent...

Karma Kafe has been a Hit or Miss kind of place for me. I've probably been to Karma a handful of times - a few times for the lunch buffet and a few take outs and here is my experience so far.Lunch Buffet - While they offer a limited selection (maybe 6 -8 different choices) they certainly serve up my favorites. The food, when fresh, is EXCELLENT. However, there have been times that the service can be slow and they can be brutually slow to replace the food. Most likely, it is because they are cooking it fresh, so when they do get around to replacing it, be sure to be the first in line to snag the goods! At a very reasonable price, it can be well worth the investment if you catch them the right time.Take Out - I've ordered from them a few times, and they have been pretty good. It can be a bit pricey on a college student budget, but they do accept duckbills (my experience with this to follow). Accepts Duckbills - If there are any Stevens Students reading this review, then it is important to note that Karma accepts duckbills, but only when their machine is working. Dbills have a notorious habit of not working if the restaurant neglects the machine, or even if they take pristine care of it. I went to Karma to try to unload some of my "fake" money only to find that it wasn't working and I had blown $30 of my real hard earned cash. So just  be prepared to have cash or credit on hand if their machine is down.Out of all the Indian places in Hoboken, I'd return to the Karma Kafe for sure. But I guess it would depend on whether I was feeling lucky or not. Maybe I could do a few good deeds during the day and hope that Karma is on my side (pun INTENDED).
Frequent visitor here......................Good food and great service. Sunday lunches recommended.....................

I've been coming here for about 6 months. They never disappoint. Everything I have tried is really good, especially the Chicken Tikka Masala. The service is great too. I usually get take out since I work in the area. Even on a busy night I never have to wait longer than 20 minutes. Fresh, fast, generous portions, and very yummy :)

Delicious and good service! Went here on a Saturday night. Had reservations for 7:30 but the restaurant didn't get really busy till after 8 when I looked around and every table was filled. Tried the "Indian" beer (not really brewed in nor imported from India). Still enjoyed it. I can't remember what kind of curry dish I had but I had it with vegetable dumplings which I've never seen before, rather than getting my usual paneer. It was pretty good although I think I still prefer paneer but glad to try something different. Sauce was delicious. Tomato based and with just the right amount of kick for someone who likes it spicy! Nice sized portions. Service was on-point the entire time but was surprised to see gratuity included for a party of just four. Thought that was strange but not a big deal to me. Will definitely be back!

I was pretty satisfied with our experience at Karma Kafe. We came as a party of 6 just before they were getting ready to break down the lunch buffet. They graciously seated us anyway. We went in thinking that you could either order from a menu or choose the buffet, but we weren't really given that choice (it might have been because we walked in so late). As a vegan, buffets can be difficult, but both of us vegans in the party had a few yummy options. The food was well-spiced and tasty. Was it the most amazing Indian food I've ever had? Not particularly. But everyone left happy and full.

My Family and I often eat here.  The Chicken Tikka Masala is excellent as are most items I have tried.  The menu incorporates most of the classics of north Indian cuisine, but they also have some really tasty innovative dishes.  I often see the owner there and can tell they take pride in their product.  A great place for a family dinner, a date, or just to grab a bit with friends.

I have never been to India, so I can't speak to the authenticity, but damn Karma Cafe is delicious!  Everything I have eaten there, including the naans, paneer palak, tandoori chicken, and biryani is absolutely delicious and I will 100% go back!

Ordered delivery after having dined in a couple of times. The person who took my order charged my credit card and said the food will arrive in 45 minutes - 1 hour (this was a direct call, not through seamless). I called an hour later and was told the food is on its way. Waited another hour, but no sign of food! When we called more than 2 hours after originally placing the order, the manager said he doesn't see my order on their computer and that the kitchen is closed!! I was given a refund but its little consolation to know you will not be getting any food at midnight. I would rather not eat from a place where orders go mysteriously missing from computers and managers imagine the food is out on its way to delivery, when its not!

I went here one night with some friends and was totally blown away. I honestly have never been a huge fan of Indian cuisine but this was fantastic. My lassi was excellent, as well as my Tandoori mixed grill and we split some Dal which was very good. I have been back and who knows.... I might be in the mood for Indian more and more.The wait staff was also on point.
Hands down best Indian food in Hoboken.  At times service is slow but their drinks are always good.  Chicken Korma is always a safe bet.  The ginger soup during the colder months is amazing!

We have been going to Karma consistently for the past 2 years or so and have never been disappointed! Great service, amazing food (tikka masala or paneer Kashmiri I strongly recommend w/ a mozzarella naan) and they have a full bar. Can't go wrong! My Go to place for dinner :)
Best Indian in Hoboken. I've eaten at this restaurant more than any other restaurant in Hoboken, plus everyone is friendly here and the make really strong drinks ;)

I haven't been here in about a year, because I am boycotting Karma Kafe.  Vegans and lactose intolerant be careful:This restaurant lied to me several times about the ingredients of one of its dishes.   I was told repeatedly that there was only coconut milk in it, only later to learn that it had cow's milk. If you have any sort of allergy, I would stay away.  They apparently are not concerned about feeding customers things they either do not want to eat or cannot eat due to allergy.  Go to Bombay West instead.  Better food, and a more honest staff.
Decent Indian food. Good sized portion. Decent service. Everything we have had so far has been quite good-Paneer, Chicken, Fish, Naan, Mango Lassi. We haven't tried the buffet though.

Been going here for years and the food is of exceptional quality and consistent in taste! The weekend brunch is a fab deal!! We often order in and the service and delivery is very good! My favorite dish: Kari Pakodi!!
This is my absolute favorite Indian restaurant. I have been there several times and the food and service is AMAZING! The Karma Aloo appetizer is unique and delicious! Highly recommended!!

Better of the Indian restaurants in the area, and is consistently good. I usually order delivery and notice the Tikka Masala is a little short chicken compared to eating there. 4 stars due to the price to chicken ratio.
Food was just OK but nothing great. I liked the chicken biriyani but the salmon dish was just average.

I order from here a lot.  I love their Indian food.  I have never been here to dine in, but their delivery is rather reasonable.  Normally is delivered in 45 minutes to an hour which is on par with most delivery places.  I like the spices they use in the sauces and recommend their samosas, and kofta makhani.  The sauce is amazing a love to dip the naan in it!

My husband and I order from here religiously.  The delivery time is a little longer than some of the other places in Hoboken (45-65 minutes, on average), but I imagine that's because they are busy making our dinners to order (that's what I tell myself anyway).  It's worth the wait.  Granted, we don't venture out far from our usual Chicken (or chickpea for me) Tikka Masala and naan, but it never disappoints.I have also been to the restaurant once and had a great experience.  Great recommendations from our waiter for appetizers.
The Peshawari Naan here is awesome! Good Indian Food  and reasonable price. But the music was  too loud and noisy place when its crowded.

You can find the best Indian food in Hoboken at Karma.  The chicken tikka masala and Saag Paneer is great.  Definitely get the garlin naan.  I also love the vegetable samosas.  The staff is friendly and you can usually get in without a wait.  I also frequently order from them on delivery.com.  The food arrives quickly and it is still hot.  I will continue to eat here as much as I can.  I highly recommend this place.

I had been to many Indians restaurant, I must day Karma is the best out of all of them. From Jersey City to Morris country I love Karma the best. Their food is so fresh, the staff is amazing as well. The location is nice the only problem is parking. Hoboken is the worse for parking but if you find a spot dont forget Karma is the place

Had a horrible experience ordering food from here.  They took 1.5hrs to deliver the food, when I was told that it would take about 40 min.  The food was semi-warm.I asked to speak with the manager, but the receptionist refused and promised to give me a free appetizer instead.The lamb in the lamb biryani appeared to be very old as it was not moist and tough to eat.I think i'll order next time to get my free appetizer and that's about it.

Really wonderful Indian food! I went with my sister and we ordered the chicken kashmiri, vegetable jalfrezi, and an assorted meat kabob - all of which I would recommend. The only downside, the food was so good an we ate so much, we basically teetered away from the restaurants with bellies too full. Service was fantastic with attentive and friendly staff. The decor was culturally charming. Highly enjoyable dinner spot in Hoboken!

Quite good Indian food at this place. I always go with lamb vindaloo when I have Indian and karma did not disappoint. My only complaint was I think when my wife ordered her food and asked for it to be hot enough to make her sweat they took it to mean we both wanted it that way and let me warn you now if you ask for super spicy they will oblige you in spades. Aside from the vindaloo we had naan which was excellent. My wife loved her chicken tikka masala as well so it was a win for sure.
Just love this place!  Chicken tikka masala. Delish. Their nan and breads so fresh!!  Wait staff friendly and attentive!!  So worth the trip to town when you're craving Indian food !!!
Excellent lunch buffet. Some of the best Indian food I have ever eaten.
Beautiful decor, delicious food and large portions. Cocktails are very tasty as well.

I have to give this place 5 stars simply by the fact that I literally eat here at least once a week.  The buffet is the best deal in town and the food is excellent.  I have never had a bad meal here.  They also have some good Indian beer if you're into that.
Good ambience ..nice decor ..Paneer kabab is yunmy however the service was very slow despite place being empty..would have given 4 star had the service was quick

I've been here a couple of times but the only reason I keep going back is for their chicken samosas. The samosas have ample chicken pieces and seasoning which make them very tasty. And each order has two so I can make a meal out of it.

Horrible. Maybe the cook had a bad day, but the chicken wings were burnt, basically lumps of coal. The service wasn't good either: long wait and staff giving me weird looks b/c I came in by myself. Will never go there again and will highly discourage anyone else from going.

The main courses are meant as individual courses, though they have a lot of food so sharing is good. The chicken tikka masala is good as well as naan and poori.  The place is small but they were not too busy (though lots of take out). Get an order of vegetable pakoora!

Absolutely incredible food and service--consistently!  This is my favorite Hoboken restaurant.  The lunch buffet is great value and offers the opportunity to sample many different dishes while providing the usual staples (i.e. chicken tikka masala and veggie samosas).  I love going for dinner because it has a vibrant, energetic atmosphere and the servers are so nice and talkative.  The mango lassi is also to-die-for.

This is the second time i have ordered from here and i cannot say i am impressed. I am indian so i know good indian food when i have it. i ordered:-papdi chaat - this is meant to be very yogurty and have a sweet tamarind sauce in there amongst the crackers, masalas, chickpea, onion, coriander, etc. there was hardly any yogurt or sauce - very dry and the crackers weren't crunchy either. chicken tikka masala - tastes ok but nothing wow. there weren't many chicken pieces but so much sauce to make the tub look fuller. garlic naan - this was pretty good. soft and freshraita - the yogurt was soooo watered down! indian raita is meant to be much thicker than how kafe karma serve it. the tomatoes didn't taste fresh either(last time i ordered a mango lasso which was ridiculously watered down too.) i also ordered a mango colada which didn't arrive. i had to call them back to remind them. it arrived 20mins later. the drink itself is pretty good. my total came to $32 for 1 person. a bit pricey for what it is. i wouldn't order from here again. may try the buffet as its much cheaper and you can see what you are about to eat

I've been here once before, but this time I went with a friend who had never had Indian food before. I usually order chicken tikka masala (which is what she ordered) whenever I go to an Indian restaurant, but this time I decided to "branch out" and order the chicken vindaloo with garlic naan. While the chicken was tasty, it was really spicy but luckily my water glass was filled every few minutes lol. The server even gave me riata to take away some of the spice which made the dish taste even better. The garlic naan was excellent, as well as the mango salsa and the free dessert of mango ice cream was delicious too! I truly enjoyed my experience and my friend enjoyed her meal as well. Whenever I'm in the Hoboken area and have a craving for Indian food, Karma it is!

Karma was pretty packed considering other places were emptying out... but their kitchen was closing (9:30) so we ordered quickly. I got the Paratha with cauliflower -- good, full of cauliflower, but not very flavorful and the Crawfish Vindaloo, after commenting that I'd never seen crawfish on an Indian menu before.This is where I say, I would have liked to have given Karma 4 stars but can't because i couldn't eat the Crawfish dish after 3 bites. It was so hot, I slurped down my water and the mango lassi to put out the fire. My bf's comment... gotta bring the snorkel when eating this dish so you don't drown in your sweat. The waiter's enthusiastically commented when i brought it to his attention... oh, this is the hottest dish in all of India! And it cannot be made less hot. It is made with ground chili pepper. Thank you Mr. Waiter for enlightening me ... a little late!Next time I will go back and try my fave, aloo golbi...

Been here several times and it's always been pretty decent. The prices for the main dishes are not cheap, but they give you a good amount of both meat and sauce, and it's pretty darn good. The Naan is also not bad, but it's PRICEY, since they are $3 each for one thin slice. The tables are a bit small, and they do not often refill the water glasses unless asked. Nothing special about the basmati rice, but I generally just eat naan as the staple.I'm a big fan of the chicken tikka masala, but they make it a little spicy for my tastes. Would not touch the Chicken vindaloo due to the level of spice, although my husband loves it. Given the price and my recent forays into making yummy chicken tikka masala from scratch at home, I rarely visit this place anymore. However, if I'm ever feeling lazy and just want some good, consistent Indian food, this is where I would go.Also, while they have validated parking, it's about 3 blocks away from the restaurant itself, so be prepared to walk.

It was one of the best Indian food I have ever had! We accidentally landed upon this place by a Zagat book.. and the trip was totally worth it. The portions were large.. (fits the price) and the food was yummy. I was soo impressed with the food that I asked my waiter if I could give them a feedback (positive ofcourse!) & gave a 5 star for most of the questions. Loved the ambience too. It's been a while since we visited this place, but haven't forgotten the taste!Thanks Karma Kafe :)

$10 lunch buffet-I come here every friday for lunch. SO GOOD that it may be the best indian food I've tried. The service is great too! Definitely recommended if you enjoy  a nice atmosphere and you're coming with friends.
Decent indian food.  All curries come with white rice and a small side. Dal makhani was delicious

the food is really delicious and the prices are totally fair.i was saddened that one time when i was there, these girls who flirted with the waiter got free drinks and I didn't (i don't really know how to flirt, i guess), but other than that, i love karma kafe!

I don't love Indian food, but I like it and sometimes crave it.  This place hits the spot.  It is local, clean, friendly, affordable, and tasty. I have ordered a lot of their offerings and haven't had a bad meal yet.  The vindaloo must be really spicy because my normally heat tolerant husband had to stop eating it, but other than that we stuff our faces every time we come.

I normally don't review but this time it was different after a horrible experience and how I got fooled after reading so many reviews and ratings. We went for weekend buffet and were very disappointed with very limited items and the food preparation and then  having to wait for Nan's after traveling for 1.5 hrs and feel like I wasted my money on a very cheaply made indian food without any good desert.

This spot is great...I will warn you, if you like Indian food you probably already know...but the lamb dish I had was so spicey I was sweating as if I just left the gym!  The Mando/yogurt drink is amazing too!

I don't remember what we ordered, but I do remember that it was good. And that I left uncomfortably full for not a lot of money. I friend recommended that the boyfriend and I come here for dinner. It was not a bad suggestion.

Yum. This is becoming my regular must eat spot when I'm in Hoboken. The restaurant is cute, conveniently located on Washington, great service and reasonably priced. I had the paneer palak and the garlic naan. Highly recommend both of them in the restaurant and as left overs.
By far my favorite Indian restaurant in Hoboken! I haven't had a dish a didn't like.

We get food from karma kafe at least twice a month. We used to order food from here much more when we first moved to hoboken. The food is great and service is good.. I highly recommend their haryali chicken wings, kadi pakora and kofta curry... Surprisingly their vegetable biryani is very good.. Tikki is not that great- it not tikki chat instead it just 3 tiikis served directly with a dipping.

This place has great food, with some very authentic preparations. Don't let the availability of a crawfish protein in just about every category mislead you into thinking otherwise.  I especially like the lamb vindaloo and korma, malai kofta, and most of the chicken entrees.  Their standards are pretty good and I have yet to be disappointed with an order.  Also, the 'fusionish' dishes i have tried have turned out to be pretty good, like the chicken tikka caesar salad.

Great place for lunch time, very reasonable price and food is above average. You have your normal lunch buffet setup with salads/rice/meat dishes. Always shoot for noon since heavy human traffic begins around 12:30ish. Try the Mango drink I think its worth $2.50 in a big glass. Pros: Nice buffet setup at lunch, with fried fish, chicken, and flavorful vegetables / sauces / fruits and all the godies. Cons: Pricey soda and service can be tad slow at times.

I have been to Karma Kafe many times and the food is always great. Bonus:Although Hoboken is one of most difficult places to find parking, they have a lot where you can park for free...Yep...!! No excuses.Only issue, there always short staff. Need more workers.
Best in town! The chicken kashmiri is fabulous. Also love their naan.

We met our "jersey" friend (she'll appreciate that..lol) in Hoboken a few weeks ago. She loves indian food and suggested this place. The food was really good. I would definitely go back there. The waiter was a little creepy, though...that's why I am not giving it five stars. I am sure glad that I don't live near this place because I would want to order take-out, but after reading the reviews about the creepy delivery guys, I would have a lot of inner conflict in that department...

Consistently great food and some really great choices on the menu - atmosphere is great (nice and quiet) - sas someone who eats Indian quite often, some of the best Indian food I've ever had in the Garden State.
mediocre indian food,  go for the lunch buffet instead of dinner

By chance we passed by this spot...the first thing that caught my eye was the pots filled with chicken and chick peas and veggies...yummm When you walk in the buffet is hot and ready plus they have menu ordered items as well. I of course did the buffet...the buffet allowed me to try...experiment....and be gluttonus ;) great stop along the way...wished had enough room for a second helping.
Great food.  Good people.  The chicken Vindaloo and Biryani rice are favorites.

KAR-MA coma coma coma coma chamee-leon!You come and goYou come and goLoving would be easy if your colors were like my dreamRed, gold and greenRed, gold and greenCopyright Culture Club.  Nineteen eighty-something.Who knew that song would seamlessly describe my experience with Indian food now and forever?  I was about to give it four stars, but Bombay West is still better.  Karma Kafe still beats its blander counterpart, India on the Hudson, by far.  Karma buffet food consisted of the usual Chicken Tikka Masala, Tandoori Chicken, Bhindi Aloo, Goat Curry, et cetera, Naan and assorted salads and desserts.  Each entree had just enough spices for the anti-spicy patron to enjoy its complex flavors without needing too much yogurt sauce to douse the flames.  I wish the staff would be more proactive, though in refilling our drinks and taking away our used plates.The $10 buffet runs Monday -Friday noon to 3 pm and Saturday -Sunday noon to 4 pm.  I'll be coming here more often because it's convenient, comfortable, and savory enough for a quick fix of Indian food.  It seemed like a popular destination for many last Sunday.  This recession is striking a chord amongst us all. Good Karma food begets good karma.  I was in a state of itis (food-induced coma) and not Nirvana.I'll definitely come and go again.

The food tasted good but I personally felt the chicken wasn't cooked well and left the chicken dish untouched. When we told the server about the chicken he took the chicken inside and checked and came back to tell us that the chicken was indeed cooked (I found this weird). I have had better and softer chicken rather than chewy chicken. Rest of the dishes were hot and tasted decent.

Take-out took exactly 2 hours, called the number and a couple of times I got hung-up on. The food was good though, but never again will I order take-out. It would have been easier for me to pick it up or eat there.

Great Indian food in a really nice setting at pretty good prices.   The restaurant has modern yet cozy colorful decor.  The outdoor tables are also great for people watching on Washington Street.My favorite dishes are the vegetarian dishes, Chana Palak and Paneer Kashmiri.  And I love the samosas and pakoras.  They have a great lunch time buffet every day of the week if you want to try a little of everything.  I get the feeling it's pretty authentic Indian food since I always see Indian families dining there.Unlike many Hoboken restaurants, this place has a bar.  That's bad if you are used to saving money with BYOB, but it's good if you want to wash down your curry with some Indian beer.The only bad thing I can say is that the service is not very good.  They aren't very attentive at the restaurant, and the take out never takes less than 45 minutes.  Still, the great food makes it worth it!  And if you go for the buffet, service isn't an issue.

So delicious! Very cute decor. I wish it felt more cozy but it's okay. When you first sit down, they have naan and three different curry sauces, which was very good.I started off with the coconut chicken soup. The chicken had a nice spice to it, but the broth was kind of lacking.. I guess I was expecting more coconut milk. My friend got tandoori, it was really good but don't remember what was in it...Chicken Tikka Masala!! So, freaking, good. I wished I wasn't so full so I could finish it all. Most of the entrees are $12, which isn't bad because the taste is worth it.I ordered a masala chai for a drink and a mango lassi.. loove the mango lassi, it had an excellent bright orange color. Hah.  I'd definitely come back.

Came here with my husband because it always seems so full, and I really do believe that to find a good restaurant, you should go to where the crowds are. The crowds were not wrong.  The food was delicious and it satisfied my Indian food cravings.  Naturally we ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala, Naan and we also got the Karma Kafe Biryani.  The Sauce in the Masala was amazing.  The chicken was just something to marinate in the sauce.  The portions were big, and I left stuffed with extras left over.  I asked to take home the few pieces of chicken and the left over sauce home, and they even offerred to give me more rice - on the house, to enjoy later. The Biryani was spicy - not necessarially in the hot sense, but just filled with flavorful spices.  At times I thought it a bit much, but really all the meats and the spices went really well together.  Though, the next time I go back, I doubt i'll order the Biryani again.  It was a good, I'll try this once type of thing, but not a regular order. All in all, it's a great indian food, and I can't wait to go back!

certainly worse that what others had to say about this place. though i might say that you can't judge a restaurant by one recipe. i ordered kashmiri chicken and keema naan. kashmiri chicken's gravy was disgusting. sweet and full of rubbish veggies. naan was soggy and keema used was some ready-made film of meat which was perhaps added in the naan as an afterthought. not ordering again, ever.

Love it!  My go to place for Indian Cuisine in HBK.  Lamb Vindaloo, Chicken Tikka Masala, Saag Paneer, tasty Basmati Rice, a side of Naan, and of course Mango Lassi.  I always try these dishes and the Lassi in any Indian Restaurant.  Their dishes delivered... delivered well lol.  The quality is very consistent, never disappointed.  They were even open during the Blizzard in Jan (yes, I would walk through a blizzard to go here).  Amazing food, will always come back for more.  lol
Good food, nice staff.  Can't compare it to other Hoboken Indian restaurants, but you'll have a very satisfying dining experience here.

best indian food (outside my moms kitchen) that ive had. very authentic and not too oily, like some other indian places. the atmosphere in the restaurant is nice as well. the food was great- the samosa chaat and the palak paneer are my favorite. the naan is so soft! they even give you some extra rice to go when you wrap up leftovers! very nice of them

I don't consider myself an Indian food aficionado, but I've had my share and I have to say: this is the BEST I've had.  Karma Kafe is one of my top 3 favorite Hoboken restaurants.I only go for the lunch buffet because, hey, I'm poor and it's all I can afford.  Besides, who wants to pay $12 for a single order of the chicken tikka masala (in my opinion, the best thing on the menu besides the naan) when you can get three times as much food as part of the buffet for $9?The chicken is actually superflous for me in the chicken tikka masala.  I could sit there for hours dipping my naan into the sauce and be a happy camper.  Their tomato and garlic based sauce is rich and creamy and is a homerun every time.The buffet usually includes a couple of veggie dishes (which are always delicious), a few meat dishes, chicken tandoori, salads (which I don't think I've ever touched), some fruit and dessert.  I've never had anything I didn't like, though I have had a couple things that were just too spicy for me.  (Not a big spicy food fan.)The service could be better, but they always bring me what I ask for, which is usually water.  For the buffet price though, I'm not complaining.  I'll happily go back anytime!

I used to order take out from here when I lived in Newport Pavonia in Jersey City and recently had the pleasure of eating here again earlier this eve. I dined in the restaurant once and found it to be a charming little cafe with pleasant service.I usually order the same items for take out: Raisin & Nut Naan, Chicken Tikki Masala, and Tandoori Chicken. All of it is YUM but my all time favorite is the Naan and Chicken Masala. I usually dip the Naan bread into my Chicken Masala sauce that is rich and creamy! It's all very delicious!The minus star is for the long wait (between 45-1 hr) wait for my take out!

Went there for lunch with a coworker to try out Karma Kafe's AYCE $10 buffet.  It was pretty good and even included our sodas.  While I have had better Indian food (in both London and NYC), it was pretty good for a buffet -- the ingredients were fresh and the spice was just right (meaning I didn't feel like soaking my head in milk afterwards).  Am definitely interested in trying them again, especially for their take-away "lunch box" menu items.
Excellent food and service. The buffet is great and good value for the price
Best indian lunch buffet in north jersey, fresh, tasty, cheap :) good service, outside  seating, tasty cocktails

It is a small restaurant, our party of 5 was accomodated without hesitation. The servers were attentive and polite. The food was spicey, fresh and delicious. The coconut lassi was so good. Just imo, I would like to see less rice and more meat in the dishes.

DEE-lish Indian food! I went with my boyfriend a couple weeks ago and was very pleased. We went early on a Saturday (just before 6:00) so it was pretty empty (just a couple other tables). By the time we left, there were a lot more people though. I order the Chicken Kashmiri, regular Naan and a Mango Lassi. Chicken Kashmiri was very tasty, though I think I preferred the Chicken Malabar that my boyfriend go (I had a small bite!). It was a lot spicier than mine, but very tasty. Naan was perfect - very soft, not burnt. The Mango Lassi was delicious, though they serve it with ice so you don't get as much. It was incredibly sweet though and totally worth it. It definitely wasn't cheap, but we left stuffed and happy. They also gave us a little coupon for a free appetizer when you buy a main course, so we'll definitely be back!
The food wasn't great and it took them an hour and a half to deliver it.

Solid Indian food.  I always judge an indian restaurant by their Chicken Tikka Masala, and this restaurant delivered.  The sauce was thick, like I like it, and well flavored.  It also came with all white meat -- so this restaurant cares about quality.  Also, I'm a fan of Palak Paneer (the spinich with the cheese cubes), which they didn't have on the menu, but they were able to accomodate us.  The dessert was just OK -- we had the galub jamun, the rice pudding, and the pistachio ice cream -- nothing too fabulous.  The other couple with us never had Indian food before, and really liked it.  I'd definitely go back!
cockroach fell into another diner's food from the ceilingwaiter poured water into my husband's ginger alealoo bindi came without aloo.disappointing will be an understatement me thinks

This is the first and only Indian restaurant that I've tried since moving to Hoboken a couple of weeks ago.  in that time I've eaten there and ordered delivery.  The delivery was pretty prompt and the waiter service at the restaurant was good.  The food is good, but not outstanding.  I normally order chicken tikka masala or paleek paneer in Indian restaurants, but Karma Kafe only has chicken tikka masala, so I had that.  It was fine, tastes like most I've had before, but maybe a little spicier.  The naan was yummy. They have a good location, just about the middle of Hoboken and only a block from my apartment.  I'm sure I'll be going back soon.
Despite the sad fact that I haven't been here in a couple of years, I still drool when I think about this place. That should tell you something!

Review of lunch buffet: a wide variety of freshly prepared chicken, fish and vegetarian options for less than $10. Significantly better than the other Indian lunch buffet in Hoboken. The space is small, but there's plenty of room on weekdays.

My friends and I trekked from NYC to Jersey City to attend a cultural festival that was a total dud when we arrived some 4 hours later after getting lost, crossing a freeway, and walking 6 miles.  We finally reached the train and decided to stop in Hoboken to eat...and New Jersey totally redeemed itself.  I've eaten Indian food all over the world except for India and this is, perhaps, the best Indian food I've had.  Certainly the best I've had in the tri-state area.  We ordered Chicken Tikka Masala, Bagare Baitan, Chana Palak, and a Veggie Sampler Appetizer.  The samosas and pakoras were perfectly fried and un-greasy.  The mango salsa stuff they served with the papadam was unlike anything I've had at other Indian joints. Very inventive and fresh.The entrees were massive and well-presented.  Perfect rice mounds, garnished with ginger or potato sticks.  The dal was creamy and flavorful - not runny and indistinct.  The first bite of the entrees was nearly foodgasmic.  Each entree was distinctly flavored and perfectly spiced.  And just when we thought the meal couldn't get any better, they brought dessert on the house - Galub Jumun.  Again, about the best I've had.  Was it the six miles we walked? Maybe.  But the service and the food at Karma was a great reward!We'd almost consider returning to NJ just to eat here...

This place is delish!  The last few Indian places my husband and I went to before this one had been disappointing.  A friend who lives in Hoboken recommended this place to us.  It is quite good!  Food was yummy and it's $10 for the lunch buffet (all-you-can-eat).  Also, their free parking (in a garage 2 blocks from the place) is a god-send because street parking in Hoboken is awful.
If you are looking to eat indian, this is the best in Hoboken !!
This is not only the best Indian food in Hoboken but also better than anything on 6th st in NYC . Quality food and friendly svc are the order of the day here. Highly recommended

This is the restaurant that introduced my girlfriend to Indian food, and suffice to say, we've been back many times over the past three years. This restaurant has a relaxing, traditional Indian atmosphere, coupled with a little Hoboken hipness, consistently good food (what you would expect from an Indian restaurant, including vegetarian offerings), and attentive service.For an appetizer, you can't go wrong with the potato and pea samosa, a South Asian style stuffed pastry.  I usually get either the chicken tikka masala or tandoori children as my entree, and it's always good. As is Indian tradition, entrees are accompanied with lentil soup and basmati rice, both of which complement the main dish. We usually get naan bread with our entrees, as well. I also recommend trying the specialty non-alcoholic fruit concoctions.  My chief complain is the beer selection, which includes typical Indian beer "trappings," such as the awful Kingfisher and Taj Mahal, as well as standards, like Miller Lite and Sam Adams Boston Lager, which is the only star on the menu, but only marginally cuts through the spiciness. I prefer my Indian dishes spicy, and this requires beers like sharp European pilsners (Prima Pils, Sierra Nevada Summerfest), weissbiers (Hacker-Pschorr Weiss), pale ales (Sierra Nevada Pale Ale) or a farmhouse ale (Saison). Although different styles, all would help to balance out spiciness, while not overpowering the delicate spices. Without the hops and malt, wine doesn't stand a chance against traditional Indian cuisine.

First time discovery for my husband and I, and we could not be happier with our choice. The Chicken Reshmi Kabab / Garlic Cheese Naan was as perfect, as the hospitality shown throughtout the entire dining experience. Will definitely revisit this great find in our new city.

When I lived in JC a few years ago I was wild about Karma.  They put a nouveau twist on classic dishes and the flavor was unbelievable.  The restaurant is really small and can feel cramped, but if you don't mind being close to other diners then it's fine.  They have sidewalk seating, too so that helps.

Quality Indian food at a decent price. While there was nothing that stood out to me while dining here with family I did enjoy all of the food. Service was good as well. My gf's brother and his family have been dining here forever and that much consistency means something.

Love the food. HOWEVER, I ordered from here via delivery.com. The order took 1 hr 15 minutes to arrive, and the delivery guy goes, "How 'bout my tip?" I've NEVER had that happen. I pointed out to him I added money to the $2.00 delivery fee on the Web site (the food total was $18). He said, "But only $1.80." I said, "Yeah, that's in addition to th $2.00." He told me he doesn't get the $2.00-- the restaurant keeps that. So, thinking maybe he has a family to feed, I ran back up the 4 flights to my apartment and got 2 more dollars for him. A dollar eighty cents isn't much, even though I was already paying nearly $4 in fees. But...seriously? I don't usually only tip 10% (I believe in tipping well), but if I did it would be at my discretion. I ended up paying about 30%, as if their food isn't expensive enough. At least he said thank you when I brought down the additional money.

I like this place and it has been consistently good for the past 8 years.  Delivery times can be a bot slow, but they almost everything on the menu that I have tried has been very good.  Thumbs up for this place.
Amazing for any scenerio - with kids or without - the service can't be beat. The decor and food are fantastic too - one of the best restaurants I've been to in Hoboken.

I am by no means an Indian food aficionado, but of all the places I have eaten, Karma was by-far the blandest. Let's call it "Indian food for white people." In Hoboken, you can do much better at Bombay West (just up the street).On a note unrelated to my review/rating, what's up with the signs around town touting Karma Kafe's "best of hoboken" rating in some publications cheap eats category? When your average entree is $12, what's cheap?
Never know i liked Indian food until I went to this place for a friends birthday. I still dont know what Chicken Tikimarsala is but its effing tastey. Oh and 'Nan' bread is equally good.

Note to self: NEVER ORDER DELIVERY FROM HERE AGAIN! As I sit here and eat cold naan and under seasoned and oily vegetable korma, I wonder if I am being brash and should eat here one night.  Something tells me I won't.  I think a measure of a good restaurant is the quality of their take out/delivery....but that's just me.

Karma Kafe, for the most part, is delicious.I have my complaints, though. I have eaten there a number of times, and each time I am flabbergasted at the prices they get away with. Dinner for three, delivered = $70!  My shrimp malabar was $17 and had like 4 small shrimp in it. Our lamb vindaloo had three chunks of lamb. We each got one. What a letdown. They do not provide enough rice to accompany their mostly sauce entrees. One order of regular naan is $3, and is not nearly enough for three people.That said, I basically could not go on living knowing that I could never have their Veggie Samosa again.
I thought the food was quite good. The place is a bit crowded. A word of warning -- unlike other places I've been, the spicy warning label actually meant something.
Really tasty Indian food. I think its one of the better Indian restaurants in town. Haven't had a dish I didn't like so far. Delivery service is slow especially on weekends

Beware if you are sensitive to food coloring or care about food quality. They dye the mango lassi! The color looked electric and so we asked the staff who sheepishly confirmed. Sad to say as we have had some ok meals here... The name implies something healthful or perhaps more natural than the average dive... Clearly not the case!

So sad.   The food is decent and as an Indian American I was satisfied.  BUT it took us 2 HOURS for them to deliver our food and we live less than 1 mile away!  We've ordered delivery several times and each time they exceeded 1.5 hours.  The food is just not worth the wait.... To top it off, the service both at the restaurant and for delivery is simply unacceptable.
Love this place! The food is excellent, when both eating in the restaurant and ordering for delivery. I love the garlic naan and chicken tikka masala.

Im Indian , and when I mean Indian, born and brought up in New Delhi ( rocks! woohoo). Man this place serves rocking Indian food, really good buffet and even the veggie dishes were amazing! They had chicken kofta, minced chicken meatballs, rightly spiced in their buffet, some really good dishes, I highly reccommend this place to anyone looking for Good food!

The closest I can get to being an authority to Indian food is that I am Asian. Okay, that is lame. But I have eaten at enough Indian restaurants to have basis in saying that so far, this place is my favorite. We (my hubby and I) went to Hoboken one summer Sunday with our 4 kids ages 5 to 17 (who are all in training to develop adventurous palates). We were the first customers for the night at 530pm.For appetizer we had the bhel poori. it was good. fresh and good spice-kick at the end of each bite. this is my first time trying this dish. so does my positive feedback still count? how about the fact that my kids had seconds? and no, i didn't force them.the main dish came out and it all surprised us. we are used to 1 small-bowl-per-dish size of serving. we didn't expect much especially for $12/dish.  this place apparently has not heard of that trend. and had we known that, we wouldn't have ordered: lamb korma, butter chicken, (hefty sized) half chicken tandoori, chicken kashmiri and naan pizza for my 5 year old. Usually, we don't mind ordering less food at Indian Restaurants because the leftover sauce of any dish, we wipe the bowls clean with extra naans. And that fills up whatever holes are left in our stomach. But not this time, no holes were left to fill. A brightly-lit Gluttony sign was flashing in my mind every time I take a bite to try and finish what is left on the table. Alas, I wiped my curry drenched fingers and gave up at 3 half-filled bowls of curry.The place has nice ambiance. The other end of the table we sat in has the bay window instead of a chair. The service was prompt and attentive but not hovering. The price is unbeatable...hoping they don't scale down the serving size!I will definitely come back - even without the free app coupon they gave me after I paid.
limited items but delicious food. not heavy on stomach, good experience.

Great prices, delicious Naan, amazing dishes with the right spices, aroma, and just overall absolutely delicious food!! The portions are big too so come hungry.  I have tried other Indian restaurants, and this is the best.
I am English and the best Indian food I ever had was in Hoboken NJ, I am as surprised as you are. All dishes are excellent and all the British curry experts I have taken here have been impressed!
this place is on point.  excellent food made with high quality ingredients.  the service is phenomenal.  if you have the pleasure of being served by sunny you're in for a treat!

Reliable lunch buffet with some special touches like the Indian snack food, chat, and a delicous rice pudding and fruit for desert.  Unlike some lunch buffets where the food feels very heavy, this seems a little healthier.  And, because they are usually busy, the food doesn't sit around for hours, and they replenish regularly.  Service is reliable; as its a buffet, you don't really need much service.  You can be in and out of here in less than an hour.  Why not five stars?  Well, the food is not sublime and sometimes, the place can seem a little crowded.  Also, the restaurant floor seems to be very uneven, so you can be sitting much lower than your party, and that can be annoying.

In my opinion, Karma is the best Indian food in the boken. The Tikki Masala has a great sauce - sometimes the chicken is super tender, sometimes not so much. But the sauce....addictive. The Naan is good, but i've had much better (Maharani in Fort Lee). The Chana Palak (chick peas, spinach veggie dish i think) is an eruption of flavor. And top all that off with Kulfi (indian version of pistachio ice cream). That stuff is just fantastic. It reminds me of Halavah, but ice cream, if that makes any sense. The lunch buffet here is also high quality.

best indian place ive been to! i moved from hoboken to the city and i will only return for 1 reason- karma cafe...well 2 reasons.... the cornbread at that louisana style restaurant with the funny name near the path. those 2 places are the best in hoboken. dont eat anywhere else!
cute place to relax and enjoy a quick nibble.alittle pricey, but nice all the same

Best Indian place I tried while in NYC area. Right in the heart of Hoboken. The food is good and plenty spicy. They have a decent bar as well. The prices are reasonable and the staff is friendly. I ordered my chicken tikka masala spicy (which by their standards was EXTRA SPICY!) and the waiter offered to exchange it for a less spicy dish. I declined, but was appreciative of his kindness and attentiveness (He saw my face as I struggled to eat, lol). Their beers are nice and cold. The decor is interesting to look at. I definitely recommend this spot if you like Indian food!

Went couple of times. Very good Tandoor chicken. Mango salsa is awesome. Pulao and Kheer are perfect. Few items for a buffet but very tasty. Not a big fan of Naan or Veg items here eventhough Dal is good. But will go again for non-veg items.
Worst Indian restaurant in Hoboken. Their buffet had very limited items and almost no curries!

Awwwww yeaahhhh...this place rocks!  If you like cheap, delicious, Indian food, buffet style, then do yourself a favor and head here!  Vegetarian and meat dishes, plus some salads and dessert...I left full as hell.  They also have a full bar and rather extensive menu.  For only $10 bucks, this is a steal.

Unreal Indian food!!   I still have not found Indian food in Manhattan that rivals Karma in Hoboken (Salaam Bombay in Tribeca comes the closest)  Chana palak in insanely good...so is the papdum (no weak, flakey or nasty charred papadum here.)  Apprently, the korma is amazing too.Inside is pretty cramped though, so the bf and I usually get take out from here.   They also sell the giant Taj Mahals (Indian beer), so thats a plus.   IMO, Karma Kafe = best Indian food in NY area,

I heart Karma Kafe.Not only is their food seriously good, hot and mouth watering, they're really nice and just the right dose of attentive... not in you face all the time, but not totally MIA. And they give you little perks when you dine in house... I just got a card for a free appetizer the next time i go there.Warning, do not go out after you eat there... you're clothes will reek of indian spice for the rest of the night.
